author: National Bureau
text:
Inaugurating a panel discussion on scientific temper, Vice-President Hamid Ansari on Sunday rued the “intolerance to criticism and questioning” and lack of scientific temper in society. He added that scientific temper was a pre-requisite for innovation and research.

“Attempts to separate myth from fact, history from mythology, belief from scientifically verified facts are often frowned upon. Pursuant to it, occult is dubbed scientific and superstition as ‘culture’,” Mr. Ansari said.

The word of caution comes at a time when scientists and historians have cautioned against recent attempts at discovering modern science prevalent in ancient times. Mr. Ansari said that while individual dissenters were often ostracised or killed, books were also banned or withdrawn.
title: Scientific temper must for innovation: Ansari
